TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Variations extends System.Object

Docs.summary: The Variations class exposes essential information about the Variations system in a Site Collection that is activated with the Microsoft Office SharePoint Server 2007 Publishing feature.

example.code: Reference code on how to use this object can be found in "/_controltemplates/VariationRootLanding.ascx".

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1<class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.VariationLabel> GetLabels(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSite site) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetLabels (site As SPSite) As ReadOnlyCollection(Of VariationLabel)

Docs.param: The site for which to retrieve the labels
Docs.summary: Fetches the list of T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.VariationLabel objects on the specified site that are available for the site collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string GetPeerUrl (Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWeb web, string currentUrl, string labelTitle);
.method public static hidebysig string GetPeerUrl(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWeb web, string currentUrl, string labelTitle) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetPeerUrl (web As SPWeb, currentUrl As String, labelTitle As String) As String
public: static System::String ^ GetPeerUrl(Microsoft::SharePoint::SPWeb ^ web, System::String ^ currentUrl, System::String ^ labelTitle);

Docs.param: The starting web where the page is stored
The server-relative URL of the specified page in the starting web
The name of the target label that the page is requested in
Docs.summary: Returns the corresponding publishing page URL for the specified object.
Docs.returns: The server relative URL of the corresponding page in the specified label if there is one; otherwise, the corresponding web URL in that label if there is one, or the corresponding URL of the label
Docs.exception: Parameters are incorrectly used. A publishing web in the current context does not exist, the page does not exist in the parameter, or the target label does not exist.

Docs.summary: Returns a collection of objects whose hierarchy has been created and is accessible to the current user.
